articles.title: T√ºrkisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# T√ºrkisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare

Kosenamen sind eine wunderbare Art, deinem Partner zu zeigen, wie viel er oder sie dir bedeutet. Wenn dein Partner T√ºrkisch spricht, wird es ihn oder sie sicher freuen, wenn du diese liebevollen Ausdr√ºcke verwendest!

## Warum Kosenamen wichtig sind

Kosenamen schaffen Intimit√§t und zeigen Zuneigung. Sie sind wie ein geheimes Band zwischen zwei Menschen ‚Äì etwas Besonderes, das nur euch beiden geh√∂rt.

## Klassische Kosenamen

Die zeitlosen Klassiker funktionieren in jeder Sprache:

- **Schatz** - der universelle Liebling
- **Liebling** - klassisch und elegant
- **Mein Herz** - gef√ºhlvoll und poetisch
- **Meine Liebe** - romantisch und z√§rtlich

<CultureTip>
Kosenamen variieren oft von Region zu Region. Was in einer Gegend √ºblich ist, kann anderswo ungew√∂hnlich klingen. Frage deinen Partner, welche Namen in seiner Heimat gebr√§uchlich sind!
</CultureTip>

## S√º√üe Tiernamen

Wie in vielen Kulturen werden auch im T√ºrkischen gerne Tiernamen verwendet:

- **B√§rchen** (kleiner B√§r) - kuschelig und stark
- **M√§uschen** (kleine Maus) - s√º√ü und niedlich
- **H√§schen** (kleiner Hase) - z√§rtlich
- **Sp√§tzchen** (kleiner Spatz) - liebevoll

## Romantische Ausdr√ºcke

F√ºr besondere Momente:

- **Mein Ein und Alles** - wenn jemand alles f√ºr dich ist
- **Seelenverwandter** - f√ºr tiefe Verbindungen
- **Mein Sonnenschein** - f√ºr jemanden, der dein Leben erhellt

## Kosenamen f√ºr verschiedene Anl√§sse

### Im Alltag
Kurze, lockere Namen f√ºr den t√§glichen Gebrauch. Ein schnelles "Hey, Schatz!" funktioniert immer.

### F√ºr romantische Momente
L√§ngere, gef√ºhlvollere Ausdr√ºcke passen zu besonderen Momenten. Sag deinem Partner, was er oder sie dir bedeutet.

### Zum Necken
Humorvolle Kosenamen k√∂nnen eure Beziehung auflockern ‚Äì aber achte darauf, dass dein Partner den Humor teilt!

## Tipps zur Verwendung

1. **Frage deinen Partner**: Nicht jeder mag jeden Kosenamen. Frage, was ihm/ihr gef√§llt.
2. **Achte auf die Aussprache**: √úbe die richtige Aussprache ‚Äì nichts ist romantischer als ein korrekt ausgesprochener Kosename.
3. **Sei authentisch**: Verwende Namen, die zu euch als Paar passen.
4. **Kreiere eigene Namen**: Die pers√∂nlichsten Kosenamen sind oft selbst erfunden!
5. **Beobachte die Reaktion**: Der beste Kosename ist der, bei dem dein Partner l√§chelt.

## Die Kraft der Sprache

Kosenamen sind mehr als Worte ‚Äì sie sind kleine Liebeserkl√§rungen im Alltag. Wenn du T√ºrkisch lernst, um mit deinem Partner zu kommunizieren, sind Kosenamen ein wundervoller Anfang.

<CTA />

articles.title: Ungarsk Grammatikk for Par: Enkel Oversikt for Deg og Din Kj√¶re
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

N√•r du l√¶rer ungarsk for kj√¶resten din, kan grammatikk virke skremmende. Men ikke bekymre deg - ungarsk er faktisk logisk n√•r du f√∏rst forst√•r grunnprinsippene! Ved slutten av denne guiden vil du og partneren din kunne bygge enkle, men meningsfulle setninger p√• ungarsk.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Szeretlek"
  translation="Jeg elsker deg"
  pronunciation="SEH-ret-lek"
  context="Den viktigste setningen p√• ungarsk - bruk den ofte med din kj√¶re!"
/>

## Hvorfor Ungarsk Grammatikk Er Annerledes (Men Ikke Vanskelig!)

Ungarsk tilh√∏rer en helt annen spr√•kfamilie enn norsk. Mens vi har tre kj√∏nn (han, hun, det), har ungarsk **ingen kj√∏nn i det hele tatt**! Det betyr at du aldri trenger √• lure p√• om "bord" er hankj√∏nn eller hunkj√∏nn - det er bare "asztal".

Tenk p√• ungarsk som LEGO-klodser: du setter sammen biter (prefikser, suffikser) for √• lage mening. N√•r du f√∏rst kjenner bitene, blir det som en morsom puslespill med din partner!

## De 5 Grunnleggende Reglene

### 1. Navn Kommer Etter Verb
P√• ungarsk sier man "Elsker jeg deg" (Szeretlek t√©ged), ikke "Jeg elsker deg". Verbet kommer f√∏rst!

<VocabCard
  word="Szeretek"
  translation="Jeg elsker"
  pronunciation="SEH-ret-ek"
  example="Szeretek t√©ged."
/>

### 2. Ingen Artikler (a, an, the)
Ungarer bruker ikke "en" eller "et". "Bok" er bare "k√∂nyv" - enkelt!

### 3. Vokalharmoni - Det Magiske Systemet
Ungarske ord "lyder rett" sammen. Hvis et ord har fremre vokaler (e, i), f√•r det fremre suffikser. Dette skjer automatisk!

### 4. Suffikser I Stedet For Preposisjoner
I stedet for "i huset" sier ungarerne "huset-i" (h√°zban). Du legger til endelser direkte p√• ordet!

### 5. Du Er Alltid Inkludert
Ungarske verb viser hvem som gj√∏r handlingen. "Szeretek" betyr allerede "jeg elsker" - du trenger ikke si "jeg"!

## Romantiske Eksempler for Par

La oss se hvordan dette fungerer i praksis med ord du faktisk vil bruke:

| Ungarsk | Norsk | Grammatikk-notat |
|---------|--------|-------------------|
| **Szeretlek** | Jeg elsker deg | "Szeret" (elsker) + "-lek" (deg) |
| **Hi√°nyzol** | Jeg savner deg | "Hi√°ny" (mangel) + "-zol" (deg) |
| **V√°rlak** | Jeg venter p√• deg | "V√°r" (vente) + "-lak" (deg) |
| **Cs√≥koljalak** | Jeg vil kysse deg | "Cs√≥k" (kyss) + "-ol" (deg) |
| **√ñlellek** | Jeg klemmer deg | "√ñlel" (klemme) + "-lek" (deg) |

<CultureTip flag="üá≠üá∫" title="Ungarsk Romantikk">
Ungarer er veldig direkte med f√∏lelser. Det er helt normalt √• si "Szeretlek" flere ganger om dagen! Vil du l√¶re flere romantiske uttrykk? Sjekk ut [v√•r guide til ungarske k√¶lenavn](/learn/no/hu/hungarian-pet-names-for-your-partner/).
</CultureTip>

## Verb-B√∏ying: N√•tid

Her er de viktigste verbformene for par:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Szeret"
  meaning="√• elske"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Jeg", polish: "szeretek", english: "jeg elsker" },
    { person: "Du", polish: "szeretsz", english: "du elsker" },
    { person: "Han/Hun", polish: "szeret", english: "han/hun elsker" },
    { person: "Vi", polish: "szeret√ºnk", english: "vi elsker" },
    { person: "Dere", polish: "szerettek", english: "dere elsker" },
    { person: "De", polish: "szeretnek", english: "de elsker" }
  ]}
/>

Merk: N√•r du snakker direkte til partneren din, bruker du spesielle former som ender p√• "-lek"!

## Praktiske Setninger for Hverdagen

√òv sammen med disse enkle setningene:

1. **J√≥ reggelt, szerelmem!** (YOH reg-gelt, SEH-rel-mem) - God morgen, min kj√¶rlighet!
2. **Mit csin√°lsz?** (mit CHEE-nahl-s) - Hva gj√∏r du?
3. **V√°rlak vacsor√°ra.** (VAHR-lahk vahch-soh-rah-ah) - Jeg venter p√• deg til middag.
4. **Sz√©p vagy!** (sape vahj) - Du er vakker!
5. **Hi√°nyzol, amikor t√°vol vagy.** (HEE-ahn-sol, ah-mee-kor TAH-vol vahj) - Jeg savner deg n√•r du er borte.
6. **Szeretn√©k veled lenni.** (SEH-ret-nai-k veh-led len-nee) - Jeg vil v√¶re med deg.
7. **K√∂sz√∂n√∂m, hogy itt vagy.** (KOH-soh-nohm, hohj itt vahj) - Takk for at du er her.
8. **Mindig r√°d gondolok.** (MEEN-deeg rahd GON-doh-lohk) - Jeg tenker alltid p√• deg.

## Vanlige Feil (Og Hvordan Unng√• Dem)

### Feil 1: Blande "te" og "t√©ged"
**Feil:** Szeretlek te
**Riktig:** Szeretlek t√©ged
**Tips:** N√•r du bruker "-lek", trenger du ikke "te" (du)!

### Feil 2: Glemme vokalharmoni
**Feil:** H√°zban (i huset)
**Riktig:** H√°zban (riktig, men lyder rart)
**Tips:** Stol p√• √∏ret ditt - hvis det h√∏res feil ut, er det sannsynligvis det!

### Feil 3: For direkte oversettelse
**Feil:** Jeg elsker deg ‚Üí √ân szeretem t√©ged
**Riktig:** Szeretlek
**Tips:** Ungarsk dropper ofte pronomenet!

<CultureTip flag="üá≠üá∫" title="Ungarsk Taleflyt">
Ungarer setter pris p√• n√•r du pr√∏ver, selv om du gj√∏r feil. Din partner vil elske innsatsen! For mer hjelp med uttale, sjekk [v√•r uttaleguide for nybegynnere](/learn/no/hu/pronunciation-guide-for-beginners/).
</CultureTip>

## Hurtigreferanse

Skriv ut dette og ha det ved h√•nden:

**Viktige Suffikser:**
- -lek/-lak = deg (jeg... deg)
- -n√°k/-nek = for √• (infinitiv)
- -ban/-ben = i/p√• (innenfor)
- -n√°l/-n√©l = hos/ved

**Romantiske Verb:**
- Szeret = elske
- Hi√°nyol = savne
- V√°r = vente
- Cs√≥kol = kysse
- √ñlel = klemme

**Sp√∏rreord:**
- Mi? = Hva?
- Ki? = Hvem?
- Hol? = Hvor?
- Mikor? = N√•r?
- Mi√©rt? = Hvorfor?

## Hva Kommer Neste?

N√• som du forst√•r grunnstrukturen, er du klar for mer avanserte temaer:

- [M√∏te partnerens familje](/learn/no/hu/meeting-your-partner-s-family/) - l√¶r h√∏flige former
- [Essensielle fraser for par](/learn/no/hu/essential-hungarian-phrases-for-couples/) - utvid ordforr√•det ditt
- [Romantiske fraser for enhver anledning](/learn/no/hu/romantic-hungarian-phrases-for-every-occasion/) - bli en romantisk mester

Husk: Spr√•kl√¶ring er en reise dere tar sammen. √òv p√• disse setningene med din kj√¶re, og snart vil dere ha deres egne inside-ord og private vitser p√• ungarsk!

<CTA />

articles.title: Danish Anniversary Wishes: Romantic Messages for Your Love
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Celebrating your √•rsdag in Danish adds a beautiful layer of meaning to this special occasion. Whether you're marking your first year sammen or your golden √•rsdag, expressing your k√¶rlighed in your partner's language shows thoughtfulness and dedication to your relationship.

For everyday romantic expressions, check out our guide on [Danish romantic phrases for every occasion](/blog/en/danish-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="tillykke med √•rsdagen"
  translation="Happy Anniversary"
  pronunciation="tillykke med √•rsdagen"
  context="The perfect way to greet your partner on your special day."
/>

## Essential Anniversary Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="√•rsdag"
  translation="anniversary"
  pronunciation="√•rsdag"
  example="Today is our √•rsdag!"
/>

| Danish | English | Usage |
|---|---|---|
| √•rsdag | anniversary | The special date |
| √•r | years | Time together |
| sammen | together | United as a couple |
| altid | forever | Eternal love |
| k√¶rlighed | love | Your bond |
| fejre | celebrate | To honor the day |
| minde | memory | Cherished moments |
| milep√¶l | milestone | Important markers |

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="Danish Anniversary Traditions">
In Danish-speaking cultures, anniversaries are often celebrated with romantic dinners, meaningful gifts, and sometimes renewing vows. Each milestone year may have traditional gift themes associated with it.
</CultureTip>

## Simple Anniversary Wishes

### Short and Sweet
- **tillykke med √•rsdagen!** - Happy Anniversary!
- **Another beautiful year sammen!** - Celebrating time together
- **To many more √•r!** - Looking forward

### For Your Partner
- **You make every day special** - Expressing gratitude
- **k√¶rlighed you more each day** - Growing love
- **My heart is altid yours** - Eternal commitment

<VocabCard
  word="k√¶rlighed"
  translation="love"
  pronunciation="k√¶rlighed"
  example="k√¶rlighed grows stronger every year."
/>

## Romantic Anniversary Messages

### Heartfelt Declarations
**"Every √•rsdag with you reminds me why I chose you. You are my altid."**

**"sammen we've created a beautiful life. Here's to many more √•r of k√¶rlighed."**

### Reflective Messages
**"Looking back on our minde fills my heart with joy. Thank you for being my everything."**

**"Each milep√¶l we reach together makes our bond stronger. I v√¶rds√¶tte every moment with you."**

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="Anniversary Milestone Names">
Different √•rsdag √•r have traditional names: first (paper), fifth (wood), tenth (tin), twenty-fifth (silver), and fiftieth (gold). These traditions are similar across many Danish-speaking regions.
</CultureTip>

## Anniversary Messages by Year

### First Anniversary
**"One year of k√¶rlighed, laughter, and happiness. The first of many beautiful √•r sammen!"**

### Fifth Anniversary
**"Five √•r of making minde together. You still give me butterflies."**

### Tenth Anniversary
**"A decade of k√¶rlighed! Every day with you is a gift I v√¶rds√¶tte."**

### Twenty-Fifth Anniversary (Silver)
**"Twenty-five √•r of k√¶rlighed and counting. You are my greatest milep√¶l."**

### Fiftieth Anniversary (Golden)
**"Fifty √•r sammen - a golden k√¶rlighed story. You are my altid."**

## Romantic Phrases for Cards

| Occasion | Danish Message | Meaning |
|---|---|---|
| Any year | tillykke med √•rsdagen my k√¶rlighed | Happy anniversary my love |
| First year | Our first √•rsdag! | Celebrating year one |
| Special year | milep√¶l √•rsdag | Major anniversary |
| Every year | altid sammen | Eternal togetherness |

## Planning Your Anniversary Celebration

### Romantic Ideas
1. Write a card in Danish
2. Learn a Danish love song
3. Cook a traditional Danish dinner
4. Plan a trip to a Danish-speaking destination
5. Create a minde book with Danish captions

### What to Say at Dinner
- **"To us and our beautiful k√¶rlighed!"** - A perfect toast
- **"Here's to altid!"** - Raising your glass
- **"Thank you for choosing me"** - Expressing gratitude

For more terms of endearment, explore our [Danish pet names](/blog/en/danish-pet-names-and-terms-of-endearment) guide.

## Quick Reference Card

| Purpose | Say This |
|---|---|
| Greeting | tillykke med √•rsdagen! |
| Declaration | I k√¶rlighed you |
| Toast | To altid! |
| Gratitude | Thank you for every minde |

Every √•rsdag is a chance to celebrate your k√¶rlighed story. Speaking these words in Danish makes the moment even more special and shows your partner how much their language and culture mean to you.

<CTA />

–ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ ‚Äî –∫–ª—é—á –∫ —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—é –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º. –î–ª—è —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—â–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–µ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω—ã–º–∏, –Ω–æ —Å –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–æ–π –≤—ã –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏—Ö –æ—Å–≤–æ–∏—Ç–µ. –î–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —Ä–∞–∑–±–µ—Ä—ë–º –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è.

## –ó–≤—É–∫–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –Ω–µ—Ç –≤ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–º

### –ó–≤—É–∫ [Œ∏] (–≥–ª—É—Ö–æ–π "th")

<VocabCard
  word="think, three, thank"
  translation="–¥—É–º–∞—Ç—å, —Ç—Ä–∏, –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∏—Ç—å"
  pronunciation="—Å–∏–Ω–∫, —Å—Ä–∏, —Å—ç–Ω–∫"
  example="Thank you for thinking of me."
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –ü–æ–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –∫–æ–Ω—á–∏–∫ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –∑—É–±–∞–º–∏ –∏ –≤—ã–¥–æ—Ö–Ω–∏—Ç–µ. –ó–≤—É–∫ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂ –Ω–∞ ¬´—Å¬ª, –Ω–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –º—è–≥–∫–∏–π.

–°–ª–æ–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏:
- **think** [Œ∏…™≈ãk] ‚Äî –¥—É–º–∞—Ç—å
- **three** [Œ∏riÀê] ‚Äî —Ç—Ä–∏
- **Thursday** [ÀàŒ∏…úÀêzde…™] ‚Äî —á–µ—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–≥
- **birthday** [Ààb…úÀêŒ∏de…™] ‚Äî –¥–µ–Ω—å —Ä–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è

### –ó–≤—É–∫ [√∞] (–∑–≤–æ–Ω–∫–∏–π "th")

<VocabCard
  word="this, that, the"
  translation="—ç—Ç–æ—Ç, —Ç–æ—Ç, –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—å"
  pronunciation="–∑–∏—Å, –∑—ç—Ç, –∑—ç"
  example="This is the one that I love."
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –¢–∞–∫ –∂–µ, –∫–∞–∫ [Œ∏], –Ω–æ —Å –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–∞. –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∞ ¬´–∑¬ª, –Ω–æ —è–∑—ã–∫ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –∑—É–±–∞–º–∏.

–°–ª–æ–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏:
- **this** [√∞…™s] ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ—Ç
- **that** [√∞√¶t] ‚Äî —Ç–æ—Ç
- **the** [√∞…ô] ‚Äî –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—å
- **together** [t…ôÀà…°e√∞…ôr] ‚Äî –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ

<CultureTip title="–û—à–∏–±–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –¥–µ–ª–∞—é—Ç –≤—Å–µ" flag="üá∑üá∫">
–†—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—â–∏–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç [Œ∏] –Ω–∞ [—Å] –∏–ª–∏ [—Ñ], –∞ [√∞] –Ω–∞ [–∑] –∏–ª–∏ [–¥]. –ù–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ –ø–æ–π–º—É—Ç –≤–∞—Å, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –≤–∞—à—É —Ä–µ—á—å –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π.
</CultureTip>

## –ê–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–µ [r]

<VocabCard
  word="red, run, right"
  translation="–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π, –±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å, –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π"
  pronunciation="—Ä—ç–¥, —Ä–∞–Ω, —Ä–∞–π—Ç"
  example="You're right, the red roses are beautiful."
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –í –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ ¬´—Ä¬ª, –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–µ [r] –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—Å—è –±–µ–∑ –≤–∏–±—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –Ø–∑—ã–∫ –∑–∞–≥–∏–±–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ –∏ –Ω–µ –∫–∞—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω—ë–±–∞.

### –°—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ "—Ä":

| –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π | –ê–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π |
|---------|------------|
| –Ø–∑—ã–∫ –≤–∏–±—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç | –Ø–∑—ã–∫ –Ω–µ –≤–∏–±—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç |
| –ö–∞—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∞–ª—å–≤–µ–æ–ª | –ó–∞–≥–Ω—É—Ç –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ |
| –†–∞—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç—ã–π | –ú—è–≥–∫–∏–π, –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª—É—à—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–π |

–ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ:
- **really** [Ààr…™…ôli] ‚Äî –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ
- **romantic** [r…ô äÀàm√¶nt…™k] ‚Äî —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã–π
- **remember** [r…™Ààmemb…ôr] ‚Äî –ø–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç—å

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [w]

<VocabCard
  word="what, when, where, why"
  translation="—á—Ç–æ, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞, –≥–¥–µ, –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É"
  pronunciation="—É–æ—Ç, —É—ç–Ω, —É—ç—Ä, —É–∞–π"
  example="What time should we meet?"
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –ì—É–±—ã –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–ª—è—é—Ç—Å—è –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è ¬´—É¬ª, –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –∫ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–º—É –∑–≤—É–∫—É. –≠—Ç–æ –ù–ï –∑–≤—É–∫ ¬´–≤¬ª!

–†–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—ë–Ω–Ω–∞—è –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∞:
- ‚ùå "–≤–æ—Ç" –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ "—É–æ—Ç" (what)
- ‚úì –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ: –≥—É–±—ã –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–ª–µ–Ω—ã, –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Ü–µ–ª—É—è

## –ö—Ä–∞—Ç–∫–∏–µ –∏ –¥–æ–ª–≥–∏–µ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ

–í –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º –¥–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="ship [ É…™p] vs sheep [ ÉiÀêp]"
  translation="–∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª—å vs –æ–≤—Ü–∞"

  context="–†–∞–∑–Ω–∞—è –¥–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å ‚Äî —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ"
/>

### –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã –ø–∞—Ä:

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [√¶] (–∫–∞–∫ –≤ —Å–ª–æ–≤–µ "cat")

<VocabCard
  word="cat, hat, man, hand"

## –ó–≤—É–∫ […ô] (schwa) ‚Äî —Å–∞–º—ã–π —á–∞—Å—Ç—ã–π –∑–≤—É–∫

<VocabCard
  word="about, banana, problem"
  translation="–æ/–æ–∫–æ–ª–æ, –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω, –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞"
  pronunciation="—ç–±–∞—É—Ç, –±—ç–Ω—ç–Ω—ç, –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º"
  example="What about the banana problem?"
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –ù–µ–π—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π, –Ω–µ–Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∑–≤—É–∫, –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏–π –Ω–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–µ ¬´—ç¬ª. –í—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –±–µ–∑—É–¥–∞—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª–æ–≥–∞—Ö.

<CultureTip title="–°–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–≤—É—á–∞–Ω–∏—è" flag="üá¨üáß">
Schwa […ô] ‚Äî —Å–∞–º—ã–π —á–∞—Å—Ç—ã–π –∑–≤—É–∫ –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º! –û–Ω –ø–æ—è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –±–µ–∑—É–¥–∞—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª–æ–≥–∞—Ö. –ù–∞—É—á–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –µ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å, –∏ –≤–∞—à –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º.
</CultureTip>

## –ò–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º

### –£—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è ‚Äî –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç:
- "I love you." ‚Üò
- "This is beautiful." ‚Üò

### –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã —Å –¥–∞/–Ω–µ—Ç ‚Äî –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—ë—Ç:
- "Do you love me?" ‚Üó
- "Are you coming?" ‚Üó

### –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã —Å –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º–∏ ‚Äî –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç:
- "Where are you going?" ‚Üò
- "What time is it?" ‚Üò

–í –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ—á–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ —Å–≤—è–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è:

- **"I am"** ‚Üí "–∞–π–º" (—Å–æ–∫—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ)

## –£–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ö

–ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —É–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∫ –Ω–µ–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—é:

| –°–ª–æ–≤–æ | –£–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |

| **beautiful** | BEAUtiful | –ë–¨–Æ-—Ç–∏-—Ñ—É–ª |

| **together** | toGETHer | —Ç—É-–ì–ï-–∑—ç—Ä |

## –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —É–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ 1: –°–∫–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏
–ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ:
- "She sells seashells by the seashore" (–∑–≤—É–∫ [ É] –∏ [s])
- "Red lorry, yellow lorry" (–∑–≤—É–∫ [r] –∏ [l])
- "The thirty-three thieves thought they thrilled the throne" (–∑–≤—É–∫ [Œ∏])

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ 2: –ú–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–∞—Ä—ã
–û–¥–∏–Ω –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ, –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è–µ—Ç, –∫–∞–∫–æ–µ:
- ship/sheep
- this/these
- cat/cut
- bet/bat

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ 3: –ó–µ—Ä–∫–∞–ª–æ
–°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –≤ –∑–µ—Ä–∫–∞–ª–æ, –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å—è –∑–≤—É–∫–∏. –°–ª–µ–¥–∏—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≥—É–± –∏ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞.

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ 4: –ó–∞–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —Å–µ–±—è
–ó–∞–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —Å–≤–æ—é —Ä–µ—á—å –∏ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–∏–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —Å –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞.

## –°–æ–≤–µ—Ç—ã –¥–ª—è —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è

1. **–°–ª—É—à–∞–π—Ç–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ**: –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º—ã –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—ã –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º
2. **–ü–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—è–π—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏**: –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–π—Ç–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏–∫—É "shadowing"
3. **–ù–µ –±–æ–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –æ—à–∏–±–∞—Ç—å—Å—è**: –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–µ–µ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–∞
4. **–£—á–∏—Ç–µ —Ñ–æ–Ω–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∞–ª—Ñ–∞–≤–∏—Ç**: IPA –ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ª—é–±–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞
5. **–ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å —Å –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–æ–º**: –ò—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–π—Ç–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞ –º—è–≥–∫–æ –∏ —Å –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å—é

<CultureTip title="–ê–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ!" flag="üåç">
–ù–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∏–∑–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –æ—Ç –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç–∞. –õ—ë–≥–∫–∏–π –∏–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ—á–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º! –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ ‚Äî —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤–∞—Å –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª–∏.
</CultureTip>

–ü–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É–ª—É—á—à–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–Ω–æ. –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å, –∏ –≤—ã –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å. –°–∞–º–æ–µ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ–µ ‚Äî –Ω–µ –±–æ—è—Ç—å—Å—è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å!
